intro: Cacalia dulcis, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its seeds are edible and have a mild, anise-like flavor, making it a valued herb in culinary and medicinal traditions. Cacalia dulcis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
